coder 0.5.1
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Benchmarking

Classify elements

Source: R/classify.R
classify.Rd

This is the main functions of the package, performing the actual classification of cases. It is often used with output from codify as input and is sometimes followed by the index function. These three function could easily be chained together if using the magrittr pipe (%>%).

classify(x, by, ...)

# S3 method for default
classify(x, by, ...)

# S3 method for data.frame
classify(x, by, id = NULL, code = "code",
  tech_names = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

object with elements to classify (often the output from codify)
by

classification scheme of type classcodes to classify by
...

used to pass arguments between methods
id

name (as character) of variable in x to group id (for example a patient id)
code

name (as character) of variable in x containing codes to classify
tech_names

should technical column names be used? If FALSE, colnames are taken directly from group names of by, if TRUE, these are changed to more technical names avoiding special characters and are prefixed by the name of the classification scheme.

Value

Boolean matrix with one row for each element/row of x and columns for each class with corresponding class names (according to the classcodes object).

Details

Note that row order is not preserved for classify.data.frame due to performance reasons (the function is intended to work with large data sets where sorting is computationally expensive).

Row names does however identify origin (as specified by id for classify.data.frame or simply as x itself for classify.default. It should therefore be possible to manually reorder the output to maintain original order.

See also

as.data.frame.classified for a convenience function to convert the output of classify to a data frame with id column instead of row names.

Examples

# Classify individual ICD10-codes by Elixhauser
classify(c("C80", "I20", "unvalid_code"), by = "elix_icd10")
#>              congestive heart failure cardiac arrhythmias valvular disease
#> C80                             FALSE               FALSE            FALSE
#> I20                             FALSE               FALSE            FALSE
#> unvalid_code                    FALSE               FALSE            FALSE
#>              pulmonary circulation disorder peripheral vascular disorder
#> C80                                   FALSE                        FALSE
#> I20                                   FALSE                        FALSE
#> unvalid_code                          FALSE                        FALSE
#>              hypertension uncomplicated hypertension complicated paralysis
#> C80                               FALSE                    FALSE     FALSE
#> I20                               FALSE                    FALSE     FALSE
#> unvalid_code                      FALSE                    FALSE     FALSE
#>              other neurological disorders chronic pulmonary disease
#> C80                                 FALSE                     FALSE
#> I20                                 FALSE                     FALSE
#> unvalid_code                        FALSE                     FALSE
#>              diabetes uncomplicated diabetes complicated hypothyroidism
#> C80                           FALSE                FALSE          FALSE
#> I20                           FALSE                FALSE          FALSE
#> unvalid_code                  FALSE                FALSE          FALSE
#>              renal failure liver disease peptic ulcer disease AIDS/HIV lymphoma
#> C80                  FALSE         FALSE                FALSE    FALSE    FALSE
#> I20                  FALSE         FALSE                FALSE    FALSE    FALSE
#> unvalid_code         FALSE         FALSE                FALSE    FALSE    FALSE
#>              metastatic cancer solid tumor rheumatoid arthritis coagulopathy
#> C80                       TRUE       FALSE                FALSE        FALSE
#> I20                      FALSE       FALSE                FALSE        FALSE
#> unvalid_code             FALSE       FALSE                FALSE        FALSE
#>              obesity weight loss fluid electrolyte disorders blood loss anemia
#> C80            FALSE       FALSE                       FALSE             FALSE
#> I20            FALSE       FALSE                       FALSE             FALSE
#> unvalid_code   FALSE       FALSE                       FALSE             FALSE
#>              deficiency anemia alcohol abuse drug abuse psychoses depression
#> C80                      FALSE         FALSE      FALSE     FALSE      FALSE
#> I20                      FALSE         FALSE      FALSE     FALSE      FALSE
#> unvalid_code             FALSE         FALSE      FALSE     FALSE      FALSE
#> attr(,"classcodes")
#> [1] "elix_icd10"
#> attr(,"id")
#> [1] "id"
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "classified" "matrix"    

# Classify patients by Charlson for comorbidities during
# one year before surgery
x <- codify(ex_people, ex_icd10, id = "name",
  date = "surgery", days = c(-365, 0))
(y <- classify(x, "charlson_icd10"))
